isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEMS DIAGNOSTICS - Diagnostic Procedures for Sensors and Actuators - VREF Tests using Master Diagnostics

svcproc.title: V REF Tests using Master Diagnostics

step1.para: Plug the Electronic Service Tool (EST) tool into the American Trucking Association (ATA) datalink connector and start Master Diagnostics.
Install correct breakout harness to engine harness only.

Monitor signal voltage with the EST using continuous monitor ssn. and initiating continuous monitor test (KOEO). Voltage should be near 0, unless the signal circuit is shorted or incorrectly wired to V REF, B+, or other voltage sources. See Diagnostic table in Section 7 for the sensor being tested.
Use a Digital Multimeter (DMM) to verify V REF at blue pin (V REF) in breakout harness. (Voltage should be 5V ± 0.5)

item.para: Connect positive to blue and negative to chassis ground.
If voltage is greater than 5.5V, check V REF for short to B+.
If voltage is less than 4.5V, check V REF for open or short to ground.

step1.para: Install 500 ohm harness between green (signal circuit), and blue (V REF) pins of breakout harness. Monitor signal voltage with EST.

item.para: If voltage is less than 4.5V, check signal circuit for open or short to ground.

step1.para: Use a DMM to check resistance from black pin (signal ground) of breakout harness to chassis ground.

item.para: If resistance is greater 5 ohm, check for open or high resistance between ECM and sensor connector.

step1.para: Connect engine or chassis harness to sensor.
Use the EST to clear DTCs.

item.para: If an active DTC remains after checking test conditions, replace sensor.
